content.text:
# King Zhending of Zhou

|p2=Zhōu Zhēndìng Wáng |w2=Chou Chēndìng-wangKing Chēndìng of Chou |l2=The Chaste and Calm King of Zhou
}}
King Zhending of Zhou (), personal name Ji Jie, was a king of the Chinese Zhou dynasty. He ruled between 468 BC and 441 BC.
Family
Sons:
King Zhending had four sons:
* First son, Prince Quji (; d. 441 BC), ruled as King Ai of Zhou in 441 BC
* Prince Shuxi (; d. 441 BC), ruled as King Si of Zhou in 441 BC
* Prince Wei (; d. 426 BC), ruled as King Kao of Zhou from 440 to 426 BC
* Prince Jie (; d. 415 BC), ruled as Duke Huan of Western Zhou () from 440 to 415 BC
See also
#Family tree of ancient Chinese emperors
